ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Site
Study; The code for each individual study
Notes: e.g., the name of the study in multi-grant collections

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Date of last contact
Reason for early termination
Notes: 1=Toxicity or side effects related to study medication 2=Medical reason unrelated to study medication 3=Termination by principal investigator because of non medical reasons 4=Failed to return to clinic 5=Declined study participation 6=Moved from area 7 = Death 8 = Subject no longer eligible to participate 9 = School unable/no longer willing to participate 10 = Other; 11=Lost to follow up; 12=Long wait for Parent training class to begin; 13=Not eligible to continue due to reaction in ADHD symptoms; 14=Parents/guardians satisfied with improvement/more able to cope following Parent Training; 15=Parents/guardians did not want child on medication; 16=Subject no longer meets entry criteria; 17 = Behavior deterioration; 18 = Placebo responder; 19 = MPH non-responder in titration; 20=Behavior deterioration
